FuncDef: The display sub-interface pevlan command displays information about user-VLAN sub-interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface type and number.
-

Specifies the VLAN ID in the single or outer VLAN tag carried in packets that a user-VLAN sub-interface receives.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the VLAN ID in the inner VLAN tag carried in packets that a user-VLAN sub-interface receives.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Examples: The BAS function has been disabled
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Multiple user-VLAN sub-interfaces can be configured on the same interface. To view information about these user-VLAN sub-interfaces, run the display sub-interface command. The command output helps you determine whether the user-VLAN sub-interfaces are correctly configured.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
